docs.snippet: Salman Rushdie cancels, citing assassination threat....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jaipur Literature Festival got off to a macabre start on Friday with organizers announcing that the Indian-born author Salman Rushdie would not attend the event because of a new assassination threat against him. Instead, Mr. Rushdie said he would address the event via a video link.
docs.abstract: Salman Rushdie cancels, citing assassination threat.

headline.main: A Macabre Start to the Sprawling Jaipur Lit Fest

byline.original: By VIKAS BAJAJ and SRUTHI GOTTIPATI

docs.abstract: Facebook is likely to go ahead with an initial public offering in April whether it wants to or not, a decision that is partly the company's fault. It just has too many shareholders.

docs.snippet: Take these steps to discover how the social network categorizes your political leanings....
docs.lead_paragraph: Take these steps to discover how the social network categorizes your political leanings.
docs.abstract: Facebook's traffic analysis tools can determine users' political views even when they are not clearly stated; many political campaigns are taking advantage of algorithm, paying Facebook to target particular audiences for political advertisements.

headline.main: Liberal, Moderate or Conservative? See How Facebook Labels You
headline.print_headline: Which Way  Do You Vote? Facebook  Has an Idea

docs.snippet: After the death of Philando Castile and sniper fire in Dallas were streamed on Facebook, the company faces questions about how to handle graphic content....
docs.lead_paragraph: After the death of Philando Castile and sniper fire in Dallas were streamed on Facebook, the company faces questions about how to handle graphic content.
docs.abstract: Facebook grapples with questions raised by its live-video application following real-time streaming of shooting of Philandro Castile by police in Minnesota and ambush of officers in Dallas; evolution of social media platform into news source is forcing company to realize it needs content guidelines.

headline.main: Live Footage of Shootings Forces Facebook to Confront New Role
headline.print_headline: Facebook Live Videos  Pose Tangle of Questions

docs.snippet: News content posted by publishers will show up less prominently, resulting in less traffic to companies that have come to rely on Facebook audiences....
docs.lead_paragraph: News content posted by publishers will show up less prominently, resulting in less traffic to companies that have come to rely on Facebook audiences.
docs.abstract: Facebook announces it is changing news feed algorithm so content posted by friends and family of user will show up more prominently than content posted by publishers; decision is blow to news and media outlets who rely on social media platform to access audience.

headline.main: Facebook to Change News Feed to Focus on Friends and Family
headline.print_headline: Facebook Tweaks Its News Feed to Focus on Friends and Family

byline.contributor: Mike Isaac reported from San Francisco and Sydney Ember from New York. John Herrman contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By MIKE ISAAC and SYDNEY EMBER

docs.snippet: Lawmakers who want to protect the privacy of citizens should be careful not to harm other rights....
docs.lead_paragraph: Lawmakers who want to protect the privacy of citizens should be careful not to harm other rights.
docs.abstract: Editorial warns new online privacy bill being considered by European Union could infringe upon free speech; asserts measures such as requiring companies to explicitly request permission to use consumer's data, and allow its transfer to other services, are offset by expansive right of users to delete information about themselves from search results.

headline.main: Missteps in Europe’s Online Privacy Bill
headline.print_headline: Missteps in Europe’s Online Privacy Bill
